Scenarios

Scenarios#

With ARMA you can create scenarios by adding your own uses cases to OpenAPI paths.

a_real_settings.json
{
  "update_on_start": true,
  "mock_api_from_json_file": true,
  "functions_to_endpoints": {
    "/api/v1/test/create": "ScenarioCheckBodyVariableValue",
    "/api/v1/simple": "SimpleFunction"
  }
}

Update the file:

  • functions_to_endpoints/main.py

from fastapi import Request
from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse
from jsf import JSF


class SimpleFunction:

    @classmethod
    async def response(cls, request: Request, url_data: dict):

        return JSONResponse("from SimpleFunction", status_code=201)
SimpleFunction

The SimpleFunction class is straightforward:

Its response method takes a Request object and a url_data dictionary as input.

It returns a JSON response with the message ‚Äúfrom SimpleFunction‚Äù and a status code of 201.

from fastapi import Request
from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse
from jsf import JSF

class ScenarioCheckBodyVariableValue:

    @classmethod
    async def response(cls, request: Request, url_data: dict):
        payload = await request.json()

        if payload["payload_id"] == "123":
            faker = JSF(url_data['responses']["200"]['schema'])
            fake_payload_response = faker.generate(
                n=1, use_defaults=True, use_examples=True
            )
            return JSONResponse(fake_payload_response, status_code=200)
        else:
            faker = JSF(url_data['responses']["405"]['schema'])
            fake_payload_response = faker.generate(
                n=1, use_defaults=True, use_examples=True
            )
            return JSONResponse(fake_payload_response, status_code=405)
ScenarioCheckBodyVariableValue

The ScenarioCheckBodyVariableValue class is more complex:

Its response method also takes a Request object and a url_data dictionary.

It retrieves the JSON payload from the request body using await request.json().

It checks the value of payload[‚Äúpayload_id‚Äù]:

If it‚Äôs ‚Äú123‚Äù, it uses the jsf library to generate fake data based on the schema specified in url_data[‚Äòresponses‚Äô][‚Äú200‚Äù][‚Äòschema‚Äô] and returns a JSON response with the generated data and a status code of 200.

If it‚Äôs not ‚Äú123‚Äù, it generates fake data based on the schema in url_data[‚Äòresponses‚Äô][‚Äú405‚Äù][‚Äòschema‚Äô] and returns a JSON response with the generated data and a status code of 405.

url_data schema
{

}
